intro: Primula amoena var. hypoleuca, commonly known as the white primrose, is a hybrid species within the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with oval, hairy leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland plantings.
